subject: Science
title: Earth's Magnetic Field
description: A micro-lesson that makes Earth's Magnetic Field usable.

hook.text: A compass needle points north. But why does Earth have a magnetic field at all?

buildup.text: Liquid iron in the outer core swirls as Earth rotates, generating electric currents.

discovery.text: Those currents create a magnetic field that extends thousands of km into space.

twist.text: The field flips â€” north becomes south. It's happened hundreds of times in Earth's history.

climax.text: The last flip was 780,000 years ago. The next could happen anytime.

punchline.text: Earth's magnetic field is a spinning ball of liquid iron. And it flips.

quiz.question: What generates Earth's magnetic field?
options: Liquid iron swirling in the outer core
Solar wind interacting with the atmosphere
